items.title: The turbulent life of Gaddafi's son: On the death of Saif al-Islam Gaddafi | DW Documentary
items.author: DW Documentary
items.content:
<article>On 3 February 2026, Saif al-Islam Gaddafi was shot dead by four unknown gunmen in Zintan, Libya. This documentary was produced in 2023 and has not been updated for this reupload. It traces the turbulent life of the second son of the former Libyan dictator Muammar al-Gaddafi. In 2021, Saif al-Islam Gaddafi unexpectedly announced that he would run for the presidency in Libya.

Statements from relatives and political actors paint a portrait of an unpredictable and fiercely determined man. Saif al-Islam Gaddafi‚Äôs presidential bid is a major challenge for Libya. The second son of the Libyan dictator Muammar Al Gaddafi has been convicted several times in Libya and is being prosecuted by the International Criminal Court for crimes against humanity.

Saif al-Islam Gaddafi has had an unusual life: he grew up a clan that operated with a high degree of paranoia, suspecting conspiracies at work everwhere. Later, he led a playboy lifestyle in Europe, presenting himself to the world as a reformer. In the second phase of his life, which began with the Libyan revolution of 2011, he perpetuated the repressive style of his father‚Äôs regime. He was taken prisoner by anti-Gaddafi militias who made him stand trial -- but only allowed him to take part via videolink. 

Everyone in Libya is talking about him, all kinds of rumors are doing the rounds, his life is under threat. People say he‚Äôs a crazy, sick mystic who‚Äôs absconded into the desert. What‚Äôs making him run for president, despite the death threats? Does he stand a chance of winning? What does he know about the secret machinations of his father‚Äôs regime? His eventful life mirrors the current chaos in Libya: a country divided, with one government in the east and another in the west, rival militias vying for power and foreign states influencing the conflict. With statements from relatives and political actors, the film paints a portrait of Saif al-Islam Gaddafi - an unpredictable and fiercely determined survivor who is trying to find his way.  

#documentary #dwdocumentary #dwdocs #libya #gaddafi 
______

items.title: LGBTQ+ resistance to Orb√°n | DW Documentary
items.author: DW Documentary
items.content:
<article>The mayor of Budapest, Gergely Kar√°csony, is facing criminal charges. In defiance of President Viktor Orb√°n‚Äôs ban, he organized a Pride march in the city on 28 June 2025‚Äîthe largest such event ever held in Hungary.

A few months earlier, the government had further tightened its controversial so-called Child Protection Law, which severely restricts the rights of the LGBTQ+ community in Hungary. The Pride event drew supporters both from within the country and abroad. 

Our documentary follows B√©la, Zsu, and Norbert, who refuse to be intimidated and are prepared to publicly stand up against Orb√°n‚Äôs authoritarian government.

Photographer B√©la Varadi is Roma and identifies as queer. He moved to London a few years after the right-wing nationalist Fidesz party came to power in 2010, making life increasingly hard for queer people and minorities. B√©la visited Hungary in 2025 to take photos at the Pride march.
In Budapest, B√©la meets up with Norbert, who is also Roma and queer. Norbert loves the city, but social tensions are proving challenging. Despite support from his family, Norbert is considering emigrating‚Äîa step many queer people in Hungary have already taken.

Zsu and Enik≈ë are a young lesbian couple from Budapest. They recently bought a house in the countryside and plan to move there soon. But how will they fare as outsiders in a rural community?

#documentary #dwdocumentary #dwdocs #LGBTQ+ #hungary 
______

items.title: Handling AI-Generated Code: Challenges & Best Practices ‚Ä¢ Roman Zhukov & Damian Brady
items.author: GOTO Conferences
items.content:
<article>This interview was recorded for GOTO Unscripted.
https://gotopia.tech

Check out more here:
https://gotopia.tech/articles/419

Roman Zhukov - Principal Architect - Security Communities Lead at Red Hat
Damian Brady - Staff Developer Advocate at GitHub

RESOURCES
Roman
https://github.com/rozhukov
https://www.linkedin.com/in/rozhukov

Damian
https://bsky.app/profile/damovisa.me
https://hachyderm.io/@damovisa
https://x.com/damovisa
https://github.com/Damovisa
https://www.linkedin.com/in/damianbrady
https://damianbrady.com.au

Links
https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/ai-assisted-development-and-open-source-navigating-legal-issues

DESCRIPTION
Roman Zhukov (Red Hat) and Damian Brady (GitHub) explore the evolving landscape of AI-assisted software development. They discuss how AI tools are transforming developer workflows, making developers about 20% faster on simple tasks while being 19% slower on complex ones.

The conversation covers critical topics including code quality and trust, security concerns with AI-generated code, the importance of education and best practices, and how developer roles are shifting from syntax experts to system architects. Both experts emphasize that AI tools serve as amplifiers rather than replacements, with humans remaining essential in the loop for quality, security, and licensing compliance.
